email_sequence.subject: Why your gaming floor creates 15-25% harmonic distortion (vs 5-8% in offices)
email_sequence.body:
Gaming equipment is an electrical nightmare. Slot machines and VFDs on HVAC systems create 15-25% current harmonic distortion - triple what you'd see in office buildings.

This distortion inflates your apparent power (kVA), which increases current draw and triggers higher demand charges. It's invisible to standard energy management systems.

That's why LED upgrades and BMS optimization barely move the needle for casinos. You're fighting the wrong battle.

The Vegas casino solved this by filtering harmonics at the electrical panel level - cleaning the power before it hits your meters.

Rather than debate projections, let's measure actual results at Bellagio.

30-day metered pilot using the same protocol as the Vegas deployment. We'll establish baseline demand readings, install the filtration, then measure the difference. Third-party verification included.

If we hit similar results (8.59% demand reduction), you're looking at 14-month payback with 25-40% IRR. If we don't hit meaningful savings, you've lost nothing but 30 days.

The pilot terms are straightforward - no games, no gotchas.
email_sequence.cta: Review the pilot agreement terms
